TEXT.English: [H1]Aua[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Angakkuq[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD]c.19th and 20th Century[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Aua (alternately Awa, Ava) was an Inuit angakkuq (shaman) known for his anthropological input to Greenland anthropologist Knud Rasmussen. As a shaman practicing into the 1920s, Aua provided perspective on Inuit religion at a time when it was being subsumed by introduced Christianity.
